name: rmdir
longDescription: Remove the DIRECTORY(ies), if they are empty.

options.name: p
options.description: Remove DIRECTORY, then try to remove each component of DIRECTORY. So, for example, ‘rmdir -p a/b/c’ is similar to ‘rmdir a/b/c a/b a’.  As such, it fails if any of those directories turns out not to be empty.  Use the ‘--ignore-fail-on-non-empty’ option to make it so such a failure does not evoke a diagnostic and does not cause ‘rmdir’ to exit unsuccessfully.

options.name: v
options.description: Give a diagnostic for each successful removal.  DIRECTORY is removed.

options.name: ignore-fail-on-non-empty
options.description: Ignore each failure to remove a directory that is solely because the directory is non-empty.

options.name: parents
options.description: Remove DIRECTORY, then try to remove each component of DIRECTORY. So, for example, ‘rmdir -p a/b/c’ is similar to ‘rmdir a/b/c a/b a’.  As such, it fails if any of those directories turns out not to be empty.  Use the ‘--ignore-fail-on-non-empty’ option to make it so such a failure does not evoke a diagnostic and does not cause ‘rmdir’ to exit unsuccessfully.

options.name: verbose
options.description: Give a diagnostic for each successful removal.  DIRECTORY is removed.
